title: Remove custom flame-sword cursor and restore a normal elegant cursor

requirements.text: Remove the custom interactive cursor from the React app and restore the normal system cursor across all routes.

quotes: remove it keep a normal asthetic and elegant cursor

acceptanceCriteria: `CustomCursor` is no longer rendered in the global React layout (no custom cursor overlay elements are mounted).
Global CSS no longer forces `cursor: none` for desktop devices; standard cursor behavior is restored (e.g., pointer cursor on links/buttons).
No cursor-follow animation runs on mousemove in the React app, and there are no leftover visual artifacts (ring/glow) on any page.

requirements.text: Remove the custom interactive cursor from the standalone landing page and restore the normal system cursor without breaking existing standalone interactions.

quotes: remove it keep a normal asthetic and elegant cursor

acceptanceCriteria: Standalone CSS no longer forces `cursor: none` and no longer defines/depends on `.custom-cursor-dot` / `.custom-cursor-ring` for cursor behavior.
Standalone JS no longer creates or animates custom cursor elements (the `initCustomCursor()` behavior is removed/disabled).
Mobile menu toggle, FAQ accordion, smooth scrolling, and contact-form success state continue to work when opening `frontend/static/growwithtutor-standalone/index.html` directly in a browser.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, and `frontend/src/components/ui`.
Keep backend as single-actor Motoko; no backend changes are required for this request.
nonGoals: Do not introduce a new custom cursor design or cursor image assets; revert to standard system cursor behavior.
Do not redesign the marketing site UI/branding beyond cursor behavior changes.
